clauses.question: 1. What process should the Government use to set a new emissions reduction target in legislation?
clauses.notes:
No to your AGW agenda. The government should be concentrating on reducing pollution - now THAT is man made. Sewage and
 nitrogen in our waterways, non biodegradable rubbish in our landfills and flowing into our waterways. Carbon dioxide and methane are

 not current concerns - both have been higher in the past without human input.

clauses.question: 2. If the Government sets a 2050 target now, which is the best target for New Zealand?
clauses.notes:
The major gases you are talking about here have been higher in the past without human input. Any sort of action on these indicate
 an agenda that has nothing to do with the betterment of the environment.

clauses.question: 3. How should New Zealand meet its targets?
clauses.notes:
NZ doesn't need zero carbon targets so the question is irrelevant. It needs to control the more general pollution. Carbon dioxide and
 methane are minimal in this.

clauses.question: 10. What are the most important issues for the Government to consider in setting plans to meet budgets? For example, who do we need to work with, what else needs to be considered?
clauses.notes:
NZ doesn't need "emission" targets so the question is irrelevant. It needs to control the more general pollution. Carbon dioxide and

methane are minimal in this. We should stop wasting money on projects that will have no effect on the Earth.

clauses.question: 11. The Government has proposed that the Climate Change Commission advises on and monitors New Zealand's progress towards its goals. Do you agree with these functions? See p42 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes: Another bureaucracy for no advantage to the the planet,

clauses.question: 12. What role do you think the Climate Change Commission should have in relation to the New Zealand Emissions Trading Scheme (NZ ETS)?
clauses.notes: The ETS should be disable as soon as possible.

clauses.question: 13. The Government has proposed that Climate Change Commissioners need to have a range of essential and desirable expertise. Do you agree with the proposed expertise? See p45 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes: It is just more uncontrolled power for a bureaucracy with no advantage to the the planet,

clauses.question: 14. Do you think the Zero Carbon Bill should cover adapting to climate change?
clauses.notes: There should be no zero carbon bill..

clauses.question: 15. The Government has proposed a number of new functions to help us adapt to climate change. Do you agree with the proposed functions? See p47 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes: There should be no organization to have these functions.

clauses.question: 16. Should we explore setting up a targeted adaptation reporting power that could see some organisations share information on their exposure to climate change risks?
clauses.notes: You're talking about setting up another bureaucracy that will serve no purpose to the planet.

clauses.question: Do you have any other comments you'd like to make?
clauses.notes:
The first questions "2050 Target" are obviously biased towards respondents who support these scheme. Is it designed to purposely

deter those people who disagree with this whole process before they get to the questions they can say "No" to?
